intro: Allium brachyscapum, commonly known as the narrow bulb onion, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its compact, bulbous stem and clusters of small, white or pale purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–30 centimeters and produces small, edible bulbs that are used in local cuisines. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable plant for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Allium brachyscapum is also valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to attract pollinators.
